title: Support for the UK ALMA Regional Centre Node
abstractText: The Atacama Large Milimeter/Submillimeter Array (ALMA) is the largest and most complex telescope ever built. It is designed to provide high sensitivity and high angular resolution observations of the cold gas dust in the Universe to study the origins and early evolution of galaxies, stars and planets. The work done under this application will support UK astronomers wishing to use ALMA, allowing them to extract the maximum possible science from this transformational telescope.
